Curvature Factory¶

class CurvatureFactory.CurvatureFactory[source]¶

curvature parameters computation

Methods

Curvature_FundamentalForm(ind, points, …) Curvature computation based on fundamental form when fitting bi-quadratic surface.
read_or_calculate_curvature_data(…[, …]) Reads curvature data or computes it
static Curvature_FundamentalForm(ind, points, search_radius, max_nn=None, tree=None)[source]¶

Curvature computation based on fundamental form when fitting bi-quadratic surface.

Main idea:

  1. Find neighbors

  2. Rotate so that the normal will be [0 0 1]

    the bi-quadratic surface coefficients \(d,e,f\) are zero and the fitting is of three parameters:

    \[z(x,y) = ax^2 + by^2 + cxy\]

  3. Second derivatives dictate the curvature

    \[\begin{split}{\bf H} = \begin{bmatrix} 2a & c \\ c & 2b \end{bmatrix}\end{split}\]
Parameters:
  • points (PointSet or PointSetOpen3D) – the point cloud
  • ind (int) – index of the point where the curvature is computed
  • points – pointset
  • tree (KDtree) – KD tree, if exists
  • search_radius (float) – radius of the neighborhood
  • max_nn (int) – maximum neighbors to use

Note

If the point cloud is sent as a PointSet, there’s no need to define the maximum number of points. The normals for each point are computed by PCA, when there are more than 5 neighbors.

If the point cloud is sent as a PointSetOpen3D, maximum number of neighbors should be defined. And the normals are computed via PCA within by Open3D

Returns: principal curvatures \(\kappa_1\) and \(\kappa_2\)
Return type: np.ndarray
static read_or_calculate_curvature_data(curves_path, pointset3d, localNeighborhoodParameters, delete_non_computed=False, verbose=True)[source]¶

Reads curvature data or computes it

CurvatureFactory.read_or_calculate_curvature_data('/Curvature/', p3d, {'r': 0.015, 'nn': 5})
Parameters:
  • curves_path (str) – path to file. If exists, the curvature is loaded; else, it computes it
  • pointset3d (PointSetOpen3D) – the points as PointSetOpen3D
  • localNeighborhoodParameters (dict) – search radius (‘r’) and maximum nearest neighbors (‘nn’)
  • verbose (bool) – print interim messages
  • delete_non_computed (bool) – flag to delete or leave points that their curvature wasn’t calculated. If False, these curvature values are set to -999. Default: False
Returns:

computed curvatures as Curvature property
Return type:

CurvatureProperty
